om.stdquestion
Class QContent

java.lang.Object
  om.stdquestion.QContent

public class QContent
extends java.lang.Object

Represents current content provided by a question component for use in output to user.

addInlineXHTML

public void addInlineXHTML(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
                    throws OmDeveloperException
Call to add an XHTML node that will be placed in the document flow at the place where this component is positioned.

Parameters:
n - Root node of content, which should've been created with respect to the getDocument(). Content will not be cloned, so be sure to create it afresh each time.
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

setParent

public void setParent(org.w3c.dom.Element e)
Sets the parent for any calls from now on. After this call, ensure that unsetParent is always called precisely once, unless an exception is thrown.

Parameters:
e - New parent element (must have been added already as part of addInlineXHTML call!)

unsetParent

public void unsetParent()
Unsets the parent, returning to previous parent.

addTopLevelXHTML

public void addTopLevelXHTML(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
                      throws OmDeveloperException
Call to set XHTML that will be placed at the top level in the output document (i.e. at the end of, and a direct child of, the question div).

Parameters:
n - Root node of content, which should've been created with respect to the getDocument(). Content will not be cloned, so be sure to create it afresh each time.
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

addResource

public void addResource(java.lang.String sFilename,
                        java.lang.String sMimeType,
                        byte[] abContent)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Adds a resource to the output.

A question does not need to add the same resource more than once within its lifecycle, i.e. resources do not need to be added with every request. You may not add a second resource with the same name as a first, unless it is identical.

Parameters:
sFilename - Resource filename
sMimeType - MIME type of resource (see QContent.MIME* constants)
abContent - Content of resource (QContent.convert*() or QContent.loadResource() may help here)
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the filename isn't valid

addResource

public void addResource(StandardQuestion sq,
                        java.lang.String sFilename,
                        java.lang.String sMimeType)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Adds a resource to the output, loading it from the same location as the specified reference class file. (This is a shortcut for calling loadResource and the other addResource method.)

A question does not need to add the same resource more than once within its lifecycle, i.e. resources do not need to be added with every request. You may not add a second resource with the same name as a first, unless it is identical.

Parameters:
sq - Question to load resource from
sFilename - Resource filename or path
sMimeType - MIME type of resource (see QContent.MIME* constants)
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the filename isn't valid

informFocusableFullJS

public void informFocusableFullJS(java.lang.String sID,
                                  java.lang.String sJSObjectExpression,
                                  boolean bPlain)
                           throws OmDeveloperException
Informs the system that a given XHTML element may be focused on page load. (This causes appropriate Javascript to be written so that the first such candidate is focused. The point of doing it here is that components don't need to know whether they are first or not.)

Parameters:
sID - ID that will be stored along with the object (for use in JS)
sJSObjectExpression - JS expression that will obtain object e.g. document.getElementById('..') - but use the other method if you just want that behaviour. Expression may contain single, but not double, quotes (unless you escape double quotes).
bPlain - True if in plain mode (causes nothing to happen)
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

informFocusable

public void informFocusable(java.lang.String sXHTMLID,
                            boolean bPlain)
                     throws OmDeveloperException
Informs the system that a given XHTML element may be focused on page load. (This causes appropriate Javascript to be written so that the first such candidate is focused. The point of doing it here is that components don't need to know whether they are first or not.)

Parameters:
sXHTMLID - ID (within XHTML id attribute) of the element that should be focused
bPlain - True if in plain mode (causes nothing to happen)
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

                         throws OmUnexpectedException
Converts an image to a PNG file.

Parameters:

Returns:
PNG data
Throws:
OmUnexpectedException - Any error in conversion (shouldn't happen, but...)

convertJPG

public static byte[] convertJPG(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bi)
                         throws OmUnexpectedException
Converts an image to a .jpg file using default compression level.

Parameters:
bi - BufferedImage to convert
Returns:
JPG data
Throws:
OmUnexpectedException - Any error in conversion (shouldn't happen, but...)

beginTextMode

public void beginTextMode()
Turns on text mode, in which any XHTML changes are ignored, and we start building up the text-equivalent string instead.

Nesting text mode (calling beginTextMode when already in text mode) is OK, this starts a separate nested text-equivalent buffer. Begin and end calls must be paired.

addTextEquivalent

public void addTextEquivalent(java.lang.String s)
Call to add text equivalent. All components should support text equivalents by using this method as well as addInlineXHTML().

The system will automatically add whitespace at the end of this string as necessary so that text from different components doesn't run together.

Parameters:
s - Text to add

endTextMode

public java.lang.String endTextMode()
                             throws OmDeveloperException
Turns off text mode. From this point on, XHTML changes will be included and text-equivalent strings ignored again. (Unless it's nested in text mode more than once.)

Returns:
The trimmed contents of the text-equivalent string that was built up since the beginTextMode() call
Throws:
OmDeveloperException - If you aren't in text mode
